properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued January 10 at 4:53AM PST until January 11 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Spokane WA
properties.description:
...HEAVY SNOW TODAY...

.A potent winter storm will move into the Inland Northwest
Friday. Light snow will begin in the morning hours on Friday with
snow intensity increasing Friday afternoon and night.  Snow
showers will linger through Saturday.

* WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10
inches in the valleys and 1 to 2 feet in the mountains.

* WHERE...Sandpoint, Bonners Ferry, Priest River, Eastport, and
Schweitzer Mountain Road.

* WHEN...From noon today to noon PST Saturday.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The
hazardous conditions will impact the evening commute.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow showers with periodic further
significant accumulations will likely continue through the
weekend.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can
be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TODAY TO NOON PST SATURDAY
